answers.author: Jessie Levine
answers.text:
I have used Streamsend for years and am happy with it.  I looked at Constant Contact at the time but Streamsend allowed me to upload an existing list and had better overall useability. Although staff shared a log in, we could create different lists with different users, so the Recreation Department e-mails came from the Rec Director, the Planning Department e-mails from the Planning secretary, and so on. Streamsend had a non-profit/government discount - I recall it was about $18 per month for 10,000 e-mails and we rarely exceeded it (and when we did it, it was still inexpensive).

author: Beverly Thames
text: We're trying to maintain and share our e-mail distribution lists from Groupwise, our e-mail client. It hangs on high volume distributions, which means we have to chunk out our distribution into multiple e-mails. Constant Contact has the features I'm looking for, but it only allows one user (login) per account. What are others using for e-mail marketing and list management that allows for multiple users?
title: How do you share e-mail distribution lists?
